result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric G. Parker

defendant.name: Parker, Eric G.
defendant.address: E7665 Cut Off Drive, New London, WI 54961

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Atty Engstrom - requested copies of JOC be sent to him - sent in ppe provided

Defendant Eric G. Parker in court (in custody) with attorney Scott M Engstrom. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement reached. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest pleas entered on 15CM248 Count 4 and 15CM340 Count 1 without repeater provision. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Court accepts plea to both counts and finds guilty of Count 4 in 15CM248. 
Count 5 is dismissed and read in. 
In 15CM340 Court finds guilty of Count 1 without repeater provision. 
Count 2 is dismissed and read in. 
Court further dismisses and reads in 15CM285. 
Victim notification complete. 
Sentence recommendations. 
Sentence: 
6 months jail, imposed/stayed. 
Placed on probation for period of 1 year on each count concurrent. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any dangerous weapons 
- maintain absolute sobriety 
- 51 days jail, 51 days credit (time served)

Defendant Eric G. Parker in court, in custody, with attorney Scott Engstrom. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not guilty plea entered. 
Bond continued. 
STC to be scheduled by Br. II.

Defendant Eric G. Parker appeared in court via video conference, in custody. 
Assistant District Attorney Veronica Isherwood: Present. 
Defendant arrested on warrant. 
Bond recommendations by ADA Isherwood. 
$500 signature bond ordered with conditions covering 15CM248, 15CM285 & 15CM340. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
  Defendant: Nonappearance
3:00 pm - def cld yesterday and requests a continuance - no ride today.
ADA Fassbender requests a warrant.
Court authorizes a warrant.

Defendant: Present
